Description: Joseph distributing grain in Egypt. Joseph stands on a platform of a palatial building and a servant holds a parasol over his head, he looks aghast at the scene beneath him, below figures pay to receive grain, a woman kneels and offers her necklace besides an old woman and with a crying baby before her, a number of officials sit around a stone desk at left to receive the payment and a scribe writes in his account book, a man lifts with both hands a heavy basket and another ties the neck of a sack with a rope, a man with a turban rides a camel at right surrounded by sheep and cattle, beyond are more buildings and a tall column with a statue; first state before clouds Etching
Producer name: Print made by: Jan de Bisschop
Curator's comments: This is a copy after the engraving by Bartholomeus Breenbergh, for comment see S.6039. The first state before the clouds, the artist's name and the letters in the lower margin (which is why it has been cut off)
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (1.I)
Acquisition notes: For the history of the acquisition of the Sheepshanks collection, please see Sheepshanks.1
